alert.note: Alert for Candler; Evans; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EVANS, CANDLER AND TATTNALL COUNTIES... At 339 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Aline to Lyons, and moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Metter, Collins, Cobbtown, Manassas, and Aline. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify. Be certain to monitor local radio and TV stations as well as local cable TV outlets for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
